text:
José "Pepe" Zalaquett Daher (10 March 1942 – 15 February 2020) was a Chilean lawyer. He was known for his work in the defence of human rights during the "de facto" regime that governed Chile under General Augusto Pinochet from 1973 to 1990.
On 15 November 1975, agents of the National Intelligence Directorate (DINA) arrested José Zalaquett and took him to the Tres Álamos detention centre. He was released on 30 January 1976, arrested again on 5 April, and sent into exile on 12 April. He did not return to Chile until 1986.
From 2002 to 2005 he was a member of the Inter-American Commission on Human Rights, and was its president in 2004-05.
Zalaquett died of Parkinson's disease-related problems on 15 February 2020 in Santiago de Chile, aged 77.
